chargeHist.descr: Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (4th w/in 5 yrs)
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony James St. Germaine was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).
  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony James St. Germaine in court with attorney Michael R. Cohen.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 14 CV 245 and 13 TR 1645.    1:40 PM Court calls cases and recites appearances - State recites plea agreement 14 CF 245 - plead to count 1 - plead to count 2 - count 1 $1694.00 - 150 days county jail - dl revoked 27 months and IID / count 2 - fine plus costs $550.15 total.  15 CF 80 plead to count 2  $100.00 fine plus costs and count 1 will be dismissed out right.  Atty Cohen agrees with 95 days credit as to time served - entitled to serve 19 remaining days on the electronic monitor as part of the stop program.  Defendant agrees with what has been proposed.  Court questions the defendant as to the arraignment - Atty Cohen waived reading.  Court further addressed the defendant as to the plea questionnaire. Both parties stipulate Defendant entered plea of G to 14 CF 245 counts 1 and 2 - G to count 2 in 15 CF 80.  Court finds defendant guilty of counts 1 346.63(1)(am) and 2 343.44(1)(b)  in 14 CF 245 and count 2 in 15 CF 80.  Count 1 in 15 CF 80 is dismissed.   State argues sentencing.  Atty Cohen makes argument.  Defendant addressed the Court.  

COURT:  14 CF 245 Count 1 - $1757.00 fine plus costs - 150 days county jail with credit for stayed to complete the balance on home detention 95 days credit  with huber- 27 months plus 150 days revoked - driver assessment and VIP has completed -- restricted 27 months IID on all vehicles in his name 45 days from today this is to begin ( 9/11/15) - to report to Ms. McNamer immediatel
                     Count 2 - $550.15 including costs 

15 CF 80 count 2 -  150.00 plus costs and surcharges - bond on file to be applied to fines/costs etc.  to set up a payment plan 

advised he has the right to appeal

Defendant Anthony James St. Germaine in court with attorney Michael R. Cohen.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DEF waives Preliminary Hearing, is advised of Rights.  Arraignment scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Anthony James St. Germaine in court with attorney Michael R. Cohen by phone.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 09:30 am.

APPEARANCES:  Defendant Anthony James St. Germaine in court with Attorney Michael J. Cohen who appeared via phone.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint.  DE waives time limits for preliminary hearing.  

Scheduling conference scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 11:00 am.  Court enters no pleas to misdemeanor counts at this time per DE's attorney's request.
John Yackel appeared for the state, DEF in court with Atty Micahel Cohen by phone, motion to modify bond granted
No comsumption of alcoholic beverages; No entry upon premises of businesses that sell alcohol by the drink.
reset at request of Atty Cohen
reset from 9-16 at request of DA & Def atty
Bruce Poquette appeared for the state, Atty Cohen in court reset to 9-16-14 8:30 for initial appearance

Standard STOP Program Conditions:
Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons.
Defendant shall not consume alcoholic beverages or illegal drugs.
Defendant shall not drive without a valid drivers license.
Defendant is ordered to report to Health and Human Services at 10610 Main Street, Hayward, WI within 48 hours (excluding weekends and holidays) upon release from custody to schedule an intake with a stop case manager (715-638-3317) for the purpose of setting up a procedure to monitor compliance with the bond provisions.  Failure to appear may result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, a bond modification hearing, possible bail jumping charges and / or forfeiture of any bond deposit.

Bruce Poquette for the state DEF in custody by video CBS $500.00   Absolute Sobriety  No comsumption of alcoholic beverages; No entry upon premises of businesses that sell alcohol by the drink. works at Famous Daves reset to 2-11-14 at 11am
